hero_subtitle: Master's Student in Computer Science at USP
profile_collab_bubble:
Do you want to collaborate?
Send me an email!
profile_p1: I am a Master's student at the University of São Paulo (USP), funded by BNDES and advised by Prof. João Neto. My research focuses on AI, with an emphasis on policy evaluation and machine learning.
profile_p2: I am currently CEO at Nordaris Partners and work as an AI/Data Analyst at Asibras Trading. I previously served as a Research Assistant at FEA-USP under the supervision of Gilmar Masiero. I hold a B.A. in International Relations (ESPM-SP) and a B.Sc. in Statistics (UFSCar).
profile_p3: Outside of work, I am an avid reader and enjoy sports such as boxing and chess.
profile_contact_p: Feel free to email me for any questions or collaboration opportunities: alison.sousa@usp.br.
research_paper1_citation: Valmor Comim, Gilmar Masiero, Mario Ogasavara, Alison Sousa (2025). Expanding the OLI Approach: The ERP Chinese Model. (Under review at Management and Organization Review)
research_paper4_citation: Alison Sousa, João Neto (2025). AI for Epidemiological Risk Prediction in Brazil. (Under review at Journal of Information and Data Management)
research_paper2_citation: Alison Sousa, João Neto (2025). AI for Epidemiological Risk Prediction in Brazil: A SLR. (Under review at SBC Computing Reviews)
research_paper3_citation: Alison Sousa, Igor Gondim (2022). International diversification via ETFs from the Sharpe ratio perspective. 33rd National Meeting of Administration Graduation Courses.
research_paper3_abstract: This paper explores international diversification strategies using Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs), with a particular focus on the Sharpe ratio as a performance metric. The study was presented at the 33rd National Meeting of Administration Graduation Courses.
vitae_p1: Below you can access my Curriculum Vitae documents.
